references.paper_title: Semiparametric instrumental variable estimation of treatment response models
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the semiparametric instrumental variable estimation methods used in causal inference, which is a central topic of the provided research paper.

references.paper_title: Using Wasserstein generative adversarial networks for the design of Monte Carlo simulations
references.reason: This paper introduces a method for designing Monte Carlo simulations using generative adversarial networks, which is relevant to the generation of synthetic datasets for causal inference, a key part of this research paper.
This book is a comprehensive guide to causal inference, covering many of the concepts and methods discussed in the research paper.
This book is a seminal work in the field of causality, introducing many of the concepts and methods used in causal inference, which are central to this research paper.
This paper introduces marginal structural models, a key methodology for causal inference in longitudinal settings, which is directly relevant to this research paper.
